item.title: slow your network down
item.description: Have you you ever wanted to deliberately slow down your network to test your web service over a flaky connection? You can do it with netem, the Network Emulator.

item.title: using a private container registry with gitlab
item.description: In the process of migrating our CI from self-hosted Jenkins to GitLab, I’ve encountered a couple of hurdles.

item.title: high performance kubernetes load balancing
item.description: What began as an investigation into a very stubborn intermittent error turned into a write-up on how to squeeze the most out of your Kubernetes deployment.

item.title: backing up wordpress with git
item.description: So I started this blog, and it’s running on a virtual server somewhere in the cloud. What happens if it disappears?

item.title: local development with kubernetes
item.description: I wrote this howto for work while learning Kubernetes, mostly for myself, but also for other devs to jump in and learn without racking up cloud costs.

item.title: how to make a blog
item.description: I’ve been meaning to do this for quite some time.
